It could be activities. 
"The next time I'm in Chicago I need to go the The Revolution Brewery".

I want to be able to say "I'm going to San Francisco, who do I need to see while I'm there?"
Or better yet, I want to schedule a trip to San Francisco and have the app say: "I see you're going to San Francisco, do you want to meet with Joe and talk about that business idea?

Typical CRM systems allow you to activate based on time: "Remind me on July 28th to call Joe"

Typical location based services allow me to see who of my "friends" are nearby, but that's in the present (and often too late). It also has not context or prioritization.

I can store this information in a contact record in a typical CRM for Joe, but the challenge is remembering to call him the next time I'm in San Francisco. There's no way to activate that "to do" the next time I plan to go to LA. It could be a month. It could be a year.

For example, I get introduced to Joe who lives in San Francisco and we talk on the phone. He says "the next time you're in town let me know and we'll grab lunch. We can talk about that business idea."

There are apps that let you activate by location, but NOT in advance. Also, the WHY is critical.  I can search my CRM for everyone I know in NYC, but I don't necessarily want to meet with ALL of them.

Traditional CRM's allow you to schedule things using time as an activation eg calendar items, reminders. How do I activate a reminder based on something other than time eg I'm in NYC this week, who should I be sure to connect with AND why?

We've all had this situation: you meet someone from another area and they say "Next time you're in town, let's grab drinks or coffee."

How do you store and activate this information?
